ygData.messageBody:
I totally think you're right here... I also think that for pickup groups or
first time groups communication is key. In my case, all but our tank were a
guild group. However, myself and another were alts playing with primes. So
the chanter (prime chanter) did what he always did, and did not talk to me
at all, assuming I was interchangeable with one of our guilds uber-bards
(and I'm not! lol). In the end, if he would have even spoke up and
communicated it woudl have helped.

But he did just waht you talked about, AE stunned then tried messing.
Didn't work lol!

Tani, 53rd BRD
Halana, 60th SHM

> -----Original Message-----
> From: James Schuldes [mailto:jgs@...]
> Sent: Tuesday, June 26, 2001 7:55 AM
> To: 'eqbards@yahoogroups.com'
> Subject: RE: [eqbards] Re: My fingers are numb...
>
>
> It takes a bit of coordination when a bard and enchanter are
> in the same
> group. But if they work together and both know what the plan
> is, it can
> work great. I have seen far too many enchanters commit
> suicide because they
> do not follow one simple rule:
>
> 1) Let the tanks - tank.
>
> I do believe that they panic when they see multiple mobs.
> Crowd control is
> their job after all and things seem to be out of control.
> Then they get a
> resist and a mobs turns on them. So, they AE stun. Now even
> if they mez the
> mob that resisted, they have the other ones beating on them.
> This situation
> can go down hill fast. I find that if they just wait and let
> the tanks
> tank, let the bard get one mezzed then they can pick another
> one to put to
> sleep. Or, if they pick 1 mob to work on at a time. Attempt mez, if
> resisted, back away from the group, let the bard mez the mob
> attacking the
> chanter. Also, working with a shaman and/or cleric is great
> too. The sha
> can slow and the cleric can stun. In any case, the most
> important thing is
> not not AE stun, work one mob at a time and let the tanks -
> tank. The bard
> can do the first mez on a mob and then tank it while the ench
> puts it to
> sleep long term - but again - you need to coordinate this
> plan ahead of
> time. And I have been here done this - as bard, chanter and
> cleric - team
> work, works great.
>
> Sylly Songsynger
